website_summaries.verdict: The Altec Lansing Orbit-MP3 is a great choice for any frequent flier, thanks to its travel-friendly design, low cost, and versatility--in the realm of portable speakers, this one's an excellent value.
pros: The Altec Lansing Orbit-MP3 is compact, stylish, inexpensive, and versatile
It's an incredible value for a portable speaker
cons: Like many speakers of this size, the Orbit-MP3 suffers from hollow-sounding audio

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: When I purchase this I thought the reviews and price was too good to be true.. I was pleasantly surprised. These speakers are fantastic. Small, portable, excellent battery life, and AMAZING sound. The speakers remind me of those small Bose radio systems people used to buy that packed a lot of sound. These do just the same, at a much smaller fraction of the price. I was confused why people had trouble turning it on. You just turn a circle! Even children can do this, that's why they make child-proof medication bottles! I really can't understand it, no muscle goes into turning it at all. You just turn the silver circle to 'on.' Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jen's Husband

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: We've owned this speaker for about a year and a half. We've used it around the house, at barbecues, and on car trips. I even play it next to the pool sometimes when I do water aerobics. The speaker has held up well, considering it's been dropped, thrown around, and splashed. The metal over the speaker has rusted a little, but that's my fault. I don't have any problems turning it on and off (as some of the other reviews have said). My only complaint is that it's not very loud, but given how small (and cheap) it is, I've been very happy with it. I'm actually considering buying a second, now that the price has dropped so much.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yu

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for small bucks
customer_reviews.text: Those old days of dragging out boomboxes and cd's are done! My guests and I use my patio quite a bit and this little speaker gives great background music while we are enjoying conversation and libation. It takes up little room on the table and there is no changing of cd's, adjusting volume, etc. I have bought a number of these as my guests are so impressed with this speaker, I regularly give my speaker to one of my guests. The cost is so minimal and the sound is so big. I don't think it would be enough for a dance party, but to have your own great music playing while visiting with your friends, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: lbrlartist

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre quality, some design issues
customer_reviews.text: I'll make this short, it's not an item that requires a whole lot of comments; just these: 1. Decent sound for something this plasticy. 2. On and off is achieved by twisting the entire housing, and is most often difficult to do - also, the internal switch is cheap and provides a non-positive feel (you don't know when it's really off). 3. The whole housing is made of cheap Chinese plastic, and is both fragile and temperamental - specifically, the battery case comes loose when you least expect or want it. 4. The cord is a fixed length and non-removable one - if you want the speaker more than 6" from the ipod, good luck.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding clarity
customer_reviews.text: This is the best small speaker that I have used at any price. During the summer, my wife and I listen to a lot of music on the patio, while enjoying a few beverages. This small speaker is perfect. It's not going to rock out the backyard, but the clarity is unbelievable. I would recommend ordering 3.5mm extension cable to go along with this speaker, as the built in cable is only about 8 inches long. Otherwise, great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Volksmark

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, small footprint
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought one of these a few years ago for use at work. He loved it so much he had me order another one, since we are out of town and he forgot his other one at home. The battery lasts forever in it and the sound output is very clear and loud. I used it the other day, plugged into my ipod touch to listen to music in the kitchen. I was impressed with the quality of it for less than $20. When we get home, I will take this extra one as my own, since it has proved to be handy.
customer_reviews.author: H. Knutson

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME sound- better than anything else like it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this speaker for YEARS and the sound is awesome- people ask about it all the time and can't believe the sound coming out of this small speaker. We bought the new Chill Pill and did a side-by-side comparison and this speaker was far superior and we returned the apple Chill Pill and we're buying 2 more of these for ourselves. The sound is great (really deep and full, even good base), the batteries do last forever, and it is better than any small 1 or 2 speaker systems I've listened to. Zero complaints. I'm a repeat customer for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: NICE LITTLE SPEAKER!
customer_reviews.text: I like these. I bought two and the sound is quite impressive. At first I bought if for my car and Ipod. But then I bought one of those Ipod docks that plug into my lighter from Herrington. Now I have two of these and keep one in my office. Just be sure to change the batteries when the sound gets fuzzy (like the speaker is going) but it's not, it just needs fresh batteries. NOW AFTER ABOUT 4 YEARS... I'm still using them occationally. They do get difficult to turn on and off. I learned to store them with one battery out.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby T

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first after reading several reviews stating that it's very difficult to turn it on/off by rotating the top of the speaker, but ordered it anyway. Upon receiving it, I was pretty impressed with the build and the sound quality. Turning it on is not easy, but not that difficult either. I'm using with iPhone 4 and like it very much. The length of the audio cord is on the low side and there is no lighted indicator for when the speaker is powered. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Folsom DIY Fan

customer_reviews.title: The Best MP3 Really Portable Speaker System
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of this,one for me and one for my cousin las month,and they work fine,the sound is incredible,but i didn't like 2 things about this,the first is the power switch,it doesn't work like it should,and the second is that i didn't find a right case to protect it. I like it uses 3 AAA Batteries you can buy anywhere,or use a rechargable batteries too,I am really happy with this speaker. I highly recommended this item for everybody who's looking for a perfect speaker system for any audio source.
customer_reviews.author: Prospector

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction!
customer_reviews.text: I picked up 2 of these speakers for my kids to use with their iPods. The speaker turns on/off by twisting the silver ring which runs around the entire top of the speaker. It's hard as hell to twist!!! It feels like your gonna break it if you continue twisting with full strength! Once turned on they sound great. I'm a 45 year old man with a pretty good grip and even I find it hard to turn on/off. Because of on/off issue my kids no longer use these speakers. Don't buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Little, Packs A Punch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this L'il speaker about 2 weeks ago. It's very portable and all of the good things the manufacturer says about the Orbit are true. Sounds very good for its stature. A rich, room filling sound is what I get from this L'il fella. The first one I bought had a defective power switch. Amazon did a wonderful thing. They employed their A to Z clause of their guarantee and made it all well & good. It's a very good product and with Amazon behind it, you simply cannot go wrong. I'm a customer for life with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: homeschooling and loving it!
customer_reviews.text: This has opened such a listening world for my kids and they don't fight over whose holding the ipod! I can set this up with their audiobook in the room and then they can play quietly in the room and listen. I can use it while driving the car and don't have to worry about interference. I have even stuck it in a coat pocket while we've gone on a long walk to keep them entertained with music. Its getting weekly if not daily use in this household! I bought rechargeable batteries and a charger and just keep a spare set charged at all time!
customer_reviews.author: HSHiker

customer_reviews.title: packs a big punch
customer_reviews.text: I was only lukewarm on the brand but took a chance anyway and am very happy with my purchase. The price was right, it's a single speaker instead of 2 connected by wires (less to break down the road), it's powered by batteries and it's a lot louder than you would expect from something so little and light. I used it in my hotel room the other night for our pre-dance party and it worked great and kept going for hours. And because it is self powered, it won't draw down your iPod or whatever that much faster.
customer_reviews.author: L West

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed with this version!
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT recommend this version of the Altec Speaker to anyone! It's NOT easy to use. Its difficult to twist the speaker into the on and off position. Not twisting it fully to the off position draines the batteries. An on/off button is much easier to use. The sound quality is also poor, it crackles, and has a low hollow sound. I bought another oribital speaker by Altec Lansing that is most impressive!
customer_reviews.author: AMW

customer_reviews.title: Very handy.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to listen to my iPod Touch while in the shower in the morning and while at work (when I'm alone.) The sound is much more impressive than the size of the speaker would suggest. I think Altec Lansing has added a marker to help tell you when the speaker is off, so that may help with many of the complaints of some of the other reviewer. That said, turning the speaker off is still a little difficult. I haven't found any problems with battery life, but I bought some rechargeable AAA's, so I'm not too worried about it. A very versatile iPod accessory.
customer_reviews.author: V. Reddy

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband for Christmas 8 months ago. He has barely gotten any use out of it. We were both very impressed with the size and sound. We especially loved how the cord wrapped around into the speaker. Unfortunately a few weeks ago I was using it with the sound just above halfway up on my phone and I started hearing a cracking sound. Now we can't even use it because I guess the speaker is blown :( So yes, I should have invested more money. I strongly recommend saving your money and getting higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: A. Betts

customer_reviews.title: Not for use in a car
customer_reviews.text: As noted in other reviews, the speaker is difficult to turn on and off. However, with considerable effort, I was in time successful in doing so. My major issue with the speaker is the level of amplification. It is minimally better that non-battery type speakers. I had hoped that we could use the device to listen to audio books while traveling in a car. This turned out to be not possible. Most of the books we tried to listen were barely audible. Consequently, the speaker did not amplify enough to compensate for normal road sounds in a car traveling at highway speeds.
customer_reviews.author: B.C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Altec Lansing iM207 Orbit
customer_reviews.text: This little speaker packs a punch. There is very little not to like about it. It can be heard from across the house and the quality never wanes. Some say that it is a little hard to turn on and off, but we found it to be not too hard. It is more compact than I thought it would be and fits very well in small spaces. We use it when we takes scooter rides, and it fits perfect in the little front pocket of the scooter. Definitly a good buy, at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: L. McEntire

customer_reviews.title: A bargain with great sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: I really had my doubts when I ordered this music speaker, but the price and savings could not not be resisted. However, I was pleasantly surprised with the good sound quality and many uses -- connected to my IPod for travel, patio sitting and sipping, kitchen while cooking, whirlpool bath tub side, etc. My son sneaks it out from me to use on the treadmill rather than use his headphones. So glad I purchased this nifty little speaker!
customer_reviews.author: Kaggy

customer_reviews.title: I must have received a dud
customer_reviews.text: I see the reviews for this are great. The reason I bought this was because of the reviews. Mine is horrible! The off mechanism is not a switch. The tob grill turns to turn it off. Well, mine is almost impossible to turn off. It is very cheap feeling. I would spend $10 more and get a better one. I will just give this to my friend and get another one. On a good note the sound is quite good for podcasts. Music is marginal.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: power in your pocket
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lightweight but not sucky portable speaker to take with me camping (and share my tunes with nature). When I received the orbit and plugged it in, I was very impressed. It sounded better than most large portable radios that I have heard. Of course, the bass wasn't shaking the ground, but I wasn't expecting it to. It has the ability to get quite loud and the sound was very crisp. Overall, I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Smackmeister

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistant Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is hard to turn on, but the real problem with our unit is that above volume 8 on the MP3 player, and as much as half volume on the IPOD causes the unit to "skip" and sound terrible. The first five seconds were really amazing, but the sound quality went to heck right away. Maybe we got a bad unit, but this is absolutely awful! My earbuds are just about as loud at full volume - why would I need such a quiet speaker?
customer_reviews.author: Karen Semon

customer_reviews.title: Good & Cheap
customer_reviews.text: First of let me say that this makes my work day go by so much better. I work on a forklift all day long so hearing some music just makes the time fly by. I like that it's small enough to fit into my back pocket for transport and that it's loud enough for me to hear on the forklift. The only cons I can think of is that at it's loudest it does get distorted, also it has to have AAA batteries. Other than that It's pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: it puts out great sound for a small speaker
customer_reviews.text: a wonderful little portable speaker. I'm a voice over and even have used this attached to my laptop for my voice over classes and it puts out great sound. most of my sound engineers can't believe how great it is and how well priced. it's attractive, small, easy to pack, and puts out a very decent sound.
customer_reviews.author: S. Loew

customer_reviews.title: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR...NOT WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: I received the item in perfect time- I tested it right away and it was working, though the sound quality was just OK- I took it on a trip with me right after receiving it, and when I pulled it out of the suitcase (I had carefully packed it), it was no longer working- by then, it was too late to return... bottom line: you get what you pay for (well, that would be if it did work...)- you may want to splurge for a more reliable product!
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: LOUD! Great sound.  Blows through the batteries quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This thing puts out amazing sound. I used this to play music in my golf cart, and it was very good at that. Unfortunately it used so much power! 3 AAA batteries would last about 36 holes, and then need replaces. So either use rechargable batteries or buy Duracell stock when you use it! Best sound I have heard froma compact speaker that fits perfect in a golf cart cupholder.
customer_reviews.author: JMyers

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic feel. Speaker sounds good when you can get it to turn on.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic feel. Hard to turn on and off as it is difficult to twist. But if you can get past that, you get decent sound quality in a small portable speaker. Batteries last at least several hours. Recommend spending a little more on something like a Jambox and you will be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: The im207 sounds amazing for its size, however like other reviewers stated it is impossible to turn on & off. You're supposed to turn the entire speaker. After much struggling I managed to get it to the on position & that's it - it's staying there. I think I'll take the advice of another reviewer who reverses a battery to turn it off. There is a newer model im237 with an actual on/off switch and also a protective case - at more than double the price. I gave the im207 4 stars because even with the on/off issue you can't beat the sound for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JBC

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these for stocking stuffers. The price was great at just under $15 (on sale), so I thought I'd give the a try even though there were some negative comments. The whole family loves them. It is a challenge getting the battery cover on and off, and the on/off switch is not easy to operate (there are "on" and "off" indicators, though). The sound is great for it's size.
customer_reviews.author: K. K.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great - hard to turn on or off
customer_reviews.text: Ok, great little speaker, sounds better than you would expect, takes just three little batteries, very simple to use. The trouble with this unit is that to turn it on or off you grab the silver rim of the speaker and twist it one way for on, one way for off. That action is very hard to do, seems like it doest not want to turn or hangs up somewhat. And when it does move it only moves half way. Other times it moves easily so I chalk this up to poor design. Good speaker though.
customer_reviews.author: M. Burch

customer_reviews.title: On off switch really poor idea
customer_reviews.text: Using this along with my MP3 player as a predator call and it works fine for that. Better quality than the horn style speakers most predator calls use. The cable end is not made well and you have to hold it plugged in just right. And the means for on off of the unit is horrible. A switch. Simple switch people. That's all we need. How hard is that?
customer_reviews.author: Zanzibar Dihedral

customer_reviews.title: Great compact speaker but.....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great speaker for travel. However, it is very hard for senior hands to get the cover off and on to replace batteries and also as mentioned previously to turn ON and OFF. I love the compact size and the sound is very good. You cannot expect the sound to be like twin Bose speakers! Just remember the caveat for senions on this very nice item.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to turn on/off -- believe all the reviews here
customer_reviews.text: This speaker sounds good and the cord management feature is cool, but it is basically unusable because the mechanism to turn it on and off doesn't work. Don't buy it. I bought another Altec Lansing speaker that sounds just as good and does not have this defect (Altec Lansing iM227 Orbit).
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: This is one packin' little speaker!
customer_reviews.text: I picked the Orbit out in lieu of receiving the iPod Touch for Christmas, and I use it with my Creative Zen Nano as well. Like others have mentioned, this thing offers great sound and portability; however it will hit static at very high volume (though not much of a problem considering how loud and clear it is on a standard high!). I'll admit the on/off switch issue is slightly difficult, but I actually found the battery cover to be more problematic. It's a challenge to close when you put the batteries in. Even so, I got this free with a credit, meaning for $29 or less there's little complaint for the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Anony

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: Like many before me have said the sound is excellent, the form factor is great, but the ergonomics are terrible. Turning the unit on and off is an adventure. I may have to try disassembly and lubrication of the power ring/switch, but out of the box it is easier just to remove a battery each time you turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: How to turn this on and off easily, batteries
customer_reviews.text: To turn this on and off easily, just get one of those rubber pads meant for opening sticky jar lids. As far as the batteries go, I just leave the battery cover off. Otherwise this is a fine product, I just wish it had a port for an AC adapter. I recommend this product strongly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lohse

customer_reviews.title: Works great, poor ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: The speaker itself works wondefully. Great sound for such a cheap little devise. The on/off switch can be quite a pain to use though. As soon as it gets a little dirty/dusty, it becomes incredibly difficult, if not impossible, to turn the unit on and off. I ended up having to disassemble and clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: HOCKEY PUCK SOUNDS GOOD
customer_reviews.text: The Altec-Lancing Orbit hockey puck is the best 30 dollars I ever spent. A decent sounding iPod speaker I can pocket. Sounds great for 3 AAA batteries and even good ALMOST cranked all the way up. 3 AAA cells will last me almost all week at work with intermittent use. I guess maybe 20 hours. I am quite pleased with it. _TRC_
customer_reviews.author: TODD R CASPELL

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these speakers, one for my wife, and one for me to use at work. The speakers were delivered on schedule, in fact they came a little early! BUT, my wife's speaker went bad within 15 minutes of use, without using it at it's max setting. We were casually listening to music and the sound went fuzzy, then stopped working completely. The speaker I bought for myself, however, I used off and on for about 3 months before it finally did the same thing. The sound quality was not bad at all. For the price I paid, this was not all that bad of a product. Don't buy it expecting it to last a while!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie from TX

customer_reviews.title: A voice for my digital player
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the size. This thing fits in my hand and it sounds better than that iPod fold-up four speaker thing. It runs on three AAA batteries, which makes the sound volume and quality it puts out nothing short of amazing. No, it's not a floor-shaking sound cannon. But it can be heard all over this two story house.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PORTABLE iPOD SPEAKER PUCK
customer_reviews.text: The Altec-Lancing hockey puck is the best 30 dollars I ever spent. A decent sounding iPod speaker I can pocket. Sounds great for 3 AAA batteries and even good ALMOST cranked all the way up. 3 AAA cells will last me almost all week at work with intermittent use. I guess maybe 20 hours. I am quite pleased with it. _TRC_
customer_reviews.author: TODD R CASPELL

customer_reviews.title: Quality poor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and returned this item and received another. The on off switch is near impossible to use. Seems like a manufacturing problem. I thought it was an isolated case but when i received my replacement the same problem existed. Speaker quality OK but not up to Altec Lancing standards. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: C. G. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Name brand speaker with good sound at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: It's not too difficult to install the batteries or to turn it on and off. The speaker takes 3 AAA size batteries. If you want to save money, use rechargeable batteries. Be careful not to pull the thin cord too hard; it won't retract into the speaker housing. The sound is quite good. 2-3-2009
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Altec Lansing speaker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sounding speaker, but has one major flaw---the wire is weak at the point where it is connected to the speaker. It eventually splits. I have gone thru three of these for that reason, so won't be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: round sound
customer_reviews.text: I found the Orbit-MP3 well worth it's value... very easy to carry around when traveling and the sound is great for a single speaker unit. The only problem is the opening hatch for the batteries... but it can easily be overcome. Would have been greater if it has a stand for the iPod!
customer_reviews.author: beadzie

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding/impossible to turn on/off
customer_reviews.text: The speaker sounds great for what I use it for, spoken word. But I am slightly disabled and don't have total use of both hands and find it VERY difficult to turn on/off. If you have arthritis FORGET IT. But the sound quality for voice is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hoogmoed

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker.  Surprising sound out of little speaker
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this, I was very surprised when I first powered it up and listened to it. I was actually shocked at the sound this little thing would put out for it's size and running on batteries. Plus the batteries will last for a long time for what it is. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Newt-2019

customer_reviews.title: How did this product get the high ratings
customer_reviews.text: The sound is terrible and distorted when the volume is turned up half way on my iPod Touch. It is extremely difficult to turn ON and OFF. When you turn it ON for the first time, is the only time it works smoothly. When I attempted to turn it off I had to apply a lot of force to twist it OFF. The registered markings for ON and OFF have never been aligned since I twisted it to turn it ON. Please do not waste your money. I threw this piece of junk where it belongs in my recyclables. This is a piece if crap to say it politely without cussing!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Young

customer_reviews.title: bad investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ipod. The on off switch was almost unusable to start, then it total froze up. Then the speaker just quit. This is all within 2 weeks and very sparadic use. I would return it and should, but I hate the hassle. It is in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little speaker that out performs the orbit 227 IMO ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little speaker that out performs the orbit 227 IMO which is 40 or 50 dollars. I love this speaker. The only thing I would change is adding a power button instead of the twist the top to turn it on or off.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Good Product. Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three of these speakers so far, one for myself and two for friends. The sounds quality is amazing for such a little speaker running on three AAA batteries. The only drawback at all I have found to the product is that you really have to pay attention when you turn it off. There is just a line that lines up with either on or off. If you know to pay attention to this it's not an issue. I think the new model has an LED indicator. There are not many values as good as this out there.
customer_reviews.author: R. Siebert

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ok speaker for easy listening. But I don't do ANYTHING easy. So I bought a Bose!
customer_reviews.author: Drakus666

customer_reviews.title: Great value, perfect for average user
customer_reviews.text: Overall, great speaker for the average user. I recently took it on a bus trip and it stood up to all the abuse. It was kind of hard to hear in the bus, but in a car it worked great. Sure, the on/off switch is kind of difficult to use, but I had no trouble turning it on and off. The battery cover is actually harder to remove than turning the speaker on and off. The sound from this speaker amazed me, it was perfect for my music and talk. All in all, great speaker, amazing value!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a great price that arrived just in time for Christmas. They sound great for being such small speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Bolted4Life

customer_reviews.title: Fine if not moved
customer_reviews.text: The product looks good and it's simple to use, though the on/off switch is difficult to use. Turning it on or off requires spinning the top cap which tends to be rather tough to turn, especially with no hand grips, my hands tend to slide rather then spin the cap. My main problem with the product is the sound output. The quality is fine, though washed out near max volume. The problem is that if you move the cable whatsoever you start hearing loud static noises, so this is for stationary use only, and it requires setting it down perfectly to not cause the static.
customer_reviews.author: Shane B

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much since my dad took over ownership to use with his iPhone. The volume was decent though could be a bit louder. Also I wish it took only two AA batteries instead of three. Overall for the price I paid, it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Siao

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sound for the price. Goes through batteries quickly so get some rechargeable ones to cut down on costs.
customer_reviews.author: gdbld

customer_reviews.title: The on and off switch is not smooth....
customer_reviews.text: but the speaker sound is excellent when playing songs without heavy base. Quality is good just the on and off switch is a little tough. I leave the speaker on and get rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty much outdated and not very user friendly you can buy much better quality at this price
customer_reviews.author: spirdo

customer_reviews.title: Solid but not great
customer_reviews.text: Sound that is produced is alright for a picnic or BBQ environment but not the right portable speakers for someone who wants great audio quality. Only real complaints given the low cost is that the on/off ring is too hard to turn and the speaker can only be powered by batteries there is no AC option.
customer_reviews.author: Leon S.

customer_reviews.title: This speaker is great
customer_reviews.text: Plugging this speaker into my laptop or smart phone, turning up the volume, blows the doors off my car! This speaker requires three AAA batteries. The batteries seem to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Eggleston

customer_reviews.title: After using it 8 times, it's e-waste
customer_reviews.text: The sound was good. 8 hours of use, and the first set of batteries were still going. Then all of a sudden, the sound was garbled, and it never worked again. Now it's e-waste.
customer_reviews.author: Quisquillosa

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The product looks very good, but I had very bad fortune because the item arrived completely dead. Try to return for warranty will cost $5 o $7(50% the item cost), could be better to buy other new, but no for now.
customer_reviews.author: Julio Cesar Esparza Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, but price is going up due to rarity.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Redick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speaker for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a no-frills speaker that runs on batteries, you can't go wrong with this speaker. Overall, good sound, relatively loud, and very portable. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: It's not very durable and broke after a few months of use. looks cool , but I wouldn't recommend this unit. for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: The Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: My toy
customer_reviews.text: This is items is amazing, the sound that this speaker have is great powerful I really recommended this items if you are looking for an external small speaker with power to have fun
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: The sound is not perfect, but it's great to be able to hear ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound is not perfect, but it's great to be able to hear music or podcast through the whole room.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This little speaker has a big voice.
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe how good the sound quality is, coming from this little speaker. Very clear and crisp sound.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Girl

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This worked for two days, then completely stopped. Batteries were not the issue. It just totally died. Not very happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: Lars Tarsim

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Turn On and Off
customer_reviews.text: The service was fine - the product sounds good, but is of questionable design as it is very difficult to turn on and off. This will undoubtedly shorten the life of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sun Bum

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little speaker with a big sound
customer_reviews.text: Great little speaker. Very easy to use. Cord wraps around base for easy portability. Be careful not to leave it "on" or the batteries wear out fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Six and counting
customer_reviews.text: I have bought six of these speakers as gifts everyone loves it. Excellent sound, very portable, battery life is good just dont forget to turn it off or it will eat up your battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Rambo

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: The speaker I received was not the speaker I ordered. I ordered an IMT228 speaker. I received an Orbit MP-3 speaker which is the older design. It is a good speaker and I will keep it, but it was not what I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this speaker. Great sound for something so small. I like the built in cord, but it is very short and may be an issue for some. Uses AAA batteries instead of AA as well. I have tried several other brands and types and this is the best so far. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: David in Bighorn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money even tho it is cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker. To turn it on you have a try to twist the top which is very difficult. Then there is no light to show if the speaker is on or off. The sound is awful. Not worth it. Have another set of Sony travel speakers which are fantastic. Would buy them again but they are not available, so I tried this. Very unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH

customer_reviews.title: There are better small speakers out there
customer_reviews.text: It's kind of big, not as portable as other small speakers out there, but the quality of the sound and volume are not better.
customer_reviews.author: MattA

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: for $20 it's a great value. its small easy to transport and use. for its size it has good sound quality. its not going to blast you away or bump, but its one small speaker.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is an awesome little speaker! I was very impressed with the quality of sound so it makes my phone so much better to listen to!
customer_reviews.author: NotMe

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality -- lousy on/off switch
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is acceptable for the size and price. As mentioned in other reviews, the on/off switch is very poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Ken K

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is very good. I put in rechargeable batteries and it lasts a while. I listen to music when I shower.
customer_reviews.author: Albert.O

customer_reviews.title: Shoulda been perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Great sound. Great size. I didn't mind the twist top on/off switch. I didn't have any trouble getting batteries in and out. But after a week, the first one I bought started losing it's sound. snap, crackle, pop. I exchanged it because it was so perfect for what I wanted. The second one did the same thing, only sooner. I didn't see any other reviewers with this problem... I don't think I did anything to it. I had to send them both back and ordered a completely different speaker.
customer_reviews.author: PomsMom

customer_reviews.title: Glad they updated this product.
customer_reviews.text: The redesign of this speaker was needed. Outside that it is an awesome speaker. I have several throughout my house.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: My teenager loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Teenager loves the idea of a small speaker so she and her friends can all enjoy the MP3 player when hanging out. A little hard to turn on. Option for longer cord would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Richard P. Ammons

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sound, Good Value for the Bucks
customer_reviews.text: This is a small speaker that's great for Hotel rooms or working in the basement or garage. Sound quality is not "High Definition" but fine if your working around and want to listen to your MP3 player. Very convenient for travel, but I would not take it on the beach. For a sub $35 speaker it's an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Francis J. Conroy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: PROS Sound is excellent. It's extremely portable and the wire has it's own place to wrap around and then fits in its own slot. I love love love this. Con: It's harder than hell to turn it on and off!! Ouch.
customer_reviews.author: Deblin99

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for price
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound if not too loud. Convenient. Difficult on/off switch. Listen mostly to books and it is fine for that.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I carry this little speaker everywhere with me and now call myself "the DJ". I love playing my music for everyone and they comment on how good the sound quality is for such a little speaker.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Works great....but not long
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased two of these speakers. The first speaker lasted about 48 hours of use and then the speaker sounded blown with a crackling sound with it turned half-way up. The 2nd speaker didn't even last 20 hours before it was blown. This is a great sounding speaker but the durability is just crap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Boehnlein

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 2 weeks of use. Sound quality is decent- distortion at high volume. Very hard to turn on and off, quite irritating. Volume is good but not incredible
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bongs

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged this item into my iPhone and it scratches at all volume levels. There is no volume control on the speaker just from your source. It was so quiet I could barely hear it and I was inside. Not a good choice for someone looking for a portable speaker.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: not loud enough in car
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice little speaker but our hope was to use it to listen to audio books in the car. It does not have quite enough power. With the MP3 player turned up to full volume, you can just barely hear it without straining even in a new car in ideal road conditions. I do use it on the deck to listen to books and it works great there. The mono speaker makes for poor music quality but that was expected.
customer_reviews.author: pat b.

customer_reviews.title: This one was defected
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a couple years ago and loved it! I got it wet and developed lots of static. I bought a second one, which must've been defected, I sent it back and hoping to get a non-defected replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Follmer

customer_reviews.title: good sound
customer_reviews.text: switch was stuck. connection cord is flimzy. Nice bass sound. Works every time. I would recomend it to friends. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Altec Lansing iM207 Orbit-Great for its size and price
customer_reviews.text: For the price and portability, this orbit speaker surpasses my expectations. I connect the orbit to my new MacBook and the sound is greatly improved, both in quality and in volume.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Solid with some quirks
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the sound quality of the Altec Lansing iM207 Orbit. The "360 degree sound" is more or less true. The upward facing cone speaker gives decent sound in all directions. The quirks that others have mentioned are fairly accurate but I think are not so bad to pass on this reasonably priced speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred DeRose

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, horrible on-off button
customer_reviews.text: The on-off button is so difficult to use that my husband won't even try, but I've come to terms with it. The sound and he price couldn't be beat tho, so I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pickypassenger

customer_reviews.title: Portable speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use on a boat and they are just what I hoped they would be. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Not a big boost
customer_reviews.text: a bit pricy but it works fine, battery life is overall good for the boost of sound it provides, test something similar to check if its worth it
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Maria

product_meta.title: Altec Lansing Music Speaker
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
The ultra-portable iM207 Orbit by Altec Lansing lets you easily share your music with those around you. With a unique design that produces a full-bodied, 360-degree sound, you will hear the music loud and clear. And with a tiny footprint that easily fits in your purse or pocket, you can get the music started for an impromptu party at any time.

 

The Altec Lansing Orbit Speaker:  * projects sound in all directions; 
 * can tilt on its edge for personal listening; 
 * provides 24 hours of listening on three AAA batteries; and 
 * has built-in cord management. 



The unique round design offers a 360-degree sound. View larger. 

Tipped on its edge, the speaker can be directed for personal listening. View larger. Unique, Round Design with 360-Degree Sound
With just a quick look at the Orbit, you know you're in for something special. Its round form uses a cone design integrated with a custom Altec Lansing speaker to project full, distortion-free sound in every direction. All your friends will hear the music and wonder where the great sound is coming from. If you would like a more personal listening experience, just put the Orbit on its edge for a more focused and directed sound.  At just 3.5 inches in diameter and 1.6 inches tall, the Orbit will go wherever you go. Throw it in your pocket or purse and pull it out wherever you are: on a park bench, on the street corner, waiting for the bus. To turn it on, simply twist the entire speaker; this prevents it from accidentally turning on in your bag or pocket. And don't worry about damaging the Orbit; it's built to handle even the most reckless travelers. 

 A smartly designed integrated cable management lets you wrap the cable around the speaker and keeps the stereo mini-plug out of the way when not in use. 

 Outstanding Battery Life
You don't have to worry about battery life with the Orbit; with three AAA batteries, the Orbit will play for up to 24 continuous hours, more than enough to keep the party going all night long. 

 The Altec Lansing Orbit is backed by a one-year warranty. 

 What's in the Box
Orbit speaker (with 3.5-inch cable attached) and user's manual. 




Get the party started no matter where you are. 


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The palm-sized, lightweight Orbit-MP3 speaker system is an ideal companion for your iPod or MP3 player when you want a break from headphones. Or slip it out of a pocket or purse for an attention-getting way to share your tunes anytime, anywhere. The full-bodied, 360-degree sound will make your friends wonder where the speakers are. And with its long battery life, the music keeps playing long into the night.

 What's in the Box

 iM207 Orbit-MP3 speaker and user's manual.
feature_bullets: Compatibility: all iPods, MP3 players, CD players, laptops
Long battery life provides up to 24 hours of play on 3 AAA batteries (not included)
Smartly designed integrated cable management system; shock-resistant, rugged design that's perfect for travel
Projects music in all directions for full stereo experience; special feature lets you direct music to single listener

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars319 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
